meanings.definition: A flat surface on which a straight line joining any two points would wholly lie.
meanings.sent1: The paper was as smooth as a plane.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a plane to make the wood flat.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of flying high above the clouds on a magical plane.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast plane of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The desert stretched out like a vast plane under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: A level of existence, thought, or development.
meanings.sent1: His thoughts soared to a higher plane of understanding.
meanings.sent2: The spiritual plane is said to be beyond our physical world.
meanings.sent3: On the mental plane, he was a master of strategy.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were on a turbulent plane after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The philosophical plane of existence puzzled many scholars.

meanings.definition: A tool for smoothing or shaping wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a plane to shave off the rough edges.
meanings.sent2: She carefully ran the plane along the wooden plank.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the plane as a seesaw.
meanings.sent4: The old plane had been passed down through generations of woodworkers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the plane against the wood was rhythmic and soothing.
